metadata.title: CVE-2022-48948 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:usb: gadget: uvc: Prevent buffer overflow in setup handlerSetup function uvc_function_setup permits control transferrequests with up to 64 bytes of payload (UVC_MAX_REQUEST_SIZE),data stage handler for OUT transfer uses memcpy to copy req->actualbytes to uvc_event->data.data array of size 60. This may resultin an overflow of 4 bytes.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48948` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-208-generic - 4.15.0-208.219~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-208-generic - 4.15.0-208.219~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-208-lowlatency - 4.15.0-208.219~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1153-aws - 4.15.0-1153.166~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
